intro: Fabrisinapis, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, silvery-white fuzz. Fabrisinapis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
